page.title: 08JERSEY ROYAL POTATO (2)
page.content:
In early April the soil is worked in between the rows of potatoes, to allow the sun to warm it up, (this is known as 'banking' the potatoes). April is also the month when growers start to spray chemicals on the crops, to prevent diseases from affecting the foliage, which can in turn damage the harvest.
Harvesting begins in May, weather permitting, and continues until the end of June, or into July in a late season. The seed potatoes are the last gathered in, to await the start of the same procedure in the following autumn.
